alert.note: Alert for Beaver (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued July 09 at 6:46AM CDT until July 09 at 10:00AM CDT by NWS Amarillo
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 PM CDT THIS AFTERNOON... ...REPLACES FLASH FLOOD WARNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of the Panhandle of Oklahoma, including the following county, Beaver. Portions of the Panhandle of Texas, including the following counties, Lipscomb and Ochiltree. * WHEN...Until 300 PM CDT Sunday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. Numerous roads remain closed due to flooding. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 644 AM CDT, local law enforcement reported that water remained over roads in Beaver, Ochiltree, and Lipscomb Counties, in particular Oklahoma Highway 23 north and south of Beaver and Texas Highway 15 west of Booker. Between 1 and 4 inches of rain have fallen overnight Saturday night and an additional 1 to 4 inches of rainfall occurred Friday night. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Perryton, Beaver, Booker, Forgan, Follett, Darrouzett, Gate, Knowles, Elmwood, Balko, Mocane, Floris, Slapout, Bryans Corner, Boyd and Turpin. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
